E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And if it returns quickly, it's good; and otherwise, then strengthen that with plaster over the pit point and leave him; and do not repeat this, because otherwise you can neither bear nor control the reduction of it as days pass.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	And however the joint is adjusted according to its tortuosity; and you don't notice any cause in the patient, but that the hand is softened and cannot strengthen any cause; then know that the nerves are cut or torn, and there's no use in him except for the reduction with a cautery around it and strength you confer some cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	And once the elbow has returned, then place upon that plaster which we have used, and leave him strengthened for several days; and then let it be released and left and the hand of him exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	If the patient's movements are still restricted and occur with some gravity, then moisten that area with water and perform a few friction movements, during which they feel better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the treatment of dislocation of the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some movements cause dislocation of the fingers in all directions.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any finger is dislocated towards the two of the palm or towards the belly of the patient, then you move the finger and push back the dislocation with your thumbs, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And place your hand on top of the finger, hang that part from which it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And suspend that (part), extend that until its length is equal to that one day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it heals at night, continue this according to that narration, and do not cease to slide that (part) during the day and exercise with movements, and continue this at night; and do this for several days until it is straightened.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same as if it is dislocated in the belly of the hand, and leave that towards that part, perform your first operation on this, until it heals.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do this when it is dislocated in other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of dislocation of the hips on both sides.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When it happens to any of the hips on both sides or the neck that a complete dislocation occurs, and if there is much bruising in those areas, then there is no cure for this, as death follows the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And the sign of this is that the evacuation of the patient is outside against his will, and he cannot retain it; or some friction movements soften certain parts of him or two of his legs or both arms, or one of these; or if you rub a hip in its place, then rubbing movements cause the removal of those to four directions.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	So it has been rubbed towards the parts behind and it is called glibness.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	And the treatment of this is that you then consider whether the glibness occurs in infancy, so there is no cure for it and there is no healing of the whole.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	And in those that come by fracture or impact or similar to them, the ancient ways of treatment were said to be long-winded, for which the main point returns to profitability; but I have made it brief from the one that many excuse too much of him, based on my familiarity with his middle exposition, about which I have elaborated and structured this using various tools from him where I show this and expand upon that.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And it is said that glibness occurring in the front part of the foot doesn't heal or cure that; similarly for the one that happens between the two legs.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And only those are cured that occur in both properly as I have mentioned.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And that the patient should be laid out on his face with his arms extended close to his sides, and have his legs submerged in water so that they don't get cold.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And place a straight staff in the middle, standing it on the ground near the elbow joint around his head, and another staff at an angle supporting his feet at the other end of the leg.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And let the attendant hold the staff, and do not let it be too loose in a pit; and another attendant holds the other according to that manner.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And wrap around the patient's head and tie on a lion skin tightly; extend the end of the skin to the staff which should be under his head, and lay it there; and tighten the other skin on his buttocks with his legs, and place them in the second staff which is under his feet; and adjust all the skins and lay those there.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And the attendant extends the skin to the junction of the staff, and do not allow the two staffs and the skins at their places where they are placed to become too tight, but rather not as tightly as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor places his hands on the hip with strength until it returns, or he places one of them on that side and let's adjust his legs to the table until it returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	And if it doesn't return in this way, then take a table whose width or length is approximately three arms, and dig into the wall as we said that there is a place near the patient where one can enter from the end of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And place the edge of the table on the hip, and the doctor holds his feet at the other end, and streches there until the hip is pulled and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open the circle which is turned in the hand; and that you place on the ground should be head of the patient at the end of the leg two staffs, whose length is one arm, and place his head at the end of the leg symmetrically two staffs; and let there be a distance between each staff as long as one palm, and this has been done in each staff to pull it clockwise, and each should be firmly placed on the ground so that it doesn't move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And add one more staff around which is the circle, and let it be turned in both grooves of the two staffs.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the extremity of this is a vein in which the blood forms, its length being as long as one's hand when it's being stirred; and in the two other veins there's something akin to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And reinforce the ligaments that you have tightened in the thighs of the patient in this vein which should be at the head of him, and the ligaments that you have tightened on his hips in this artery which should be at his feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And for each joint place an attendant who twists the joints with his hands, and the doctor adjusts the spine according to what we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is how you should do it for the joint:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And when the spine has been returned and the area is adjusted, then coat with a dry poultice made from almond meal, and cover; and place on the poultice until it fills a table of three digits or about that many, and its length should be as much as the area of yellow fat, and over the part of the spine.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And bind it with the ligament that we said, and use the patient to intake subtle nourishment so that they recover.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there is any lingering risk at the site of the injury at the end of recovery, then prepare to administer medicines that purify and clean up for a long time after the table has been used, which we have recommended; and already a sheet of lead has been administered in that area.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And some inflammations may occur at the end of the spines of both sides, and it is irritated by that dislocation; and that bone which already inflames so that it should not be assumed that this medicine, which will cause you to suddenly die, should be administered to them.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXI.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated thigh.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You should know that the joint of the thigh and the joint of the muscle do not require only dislocation, but nothing like what happens to other joints with small movement and curvature occurs to them.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the thigh can be dislocated in four ways: it is dislocated towards the inside parts, or towards the outside parts, or towards the front parts, or towards the back parts.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And mostly it is dislocated towards the inside parts, and slightly towards the front parts or towards the back parts.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of dislocation towards the inside parts is that when you align the healthy leg with the other leg, it becomes longer and the diseased part is more prominent than the healthy one. The patient cannot bend their knee, they have to straighten their leg, this can only be seen in the area where there's inflammation due to heat from a cautery, because by then their thigh bone has already passed here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign for that which experiences dislocation towards the outside parts is that his accidents are against this incident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign for that which experiences dislocation towards the front is that he extends his healthy leg as if in a circle, however, it does not bend at the knee where there's pain, and if you try to force him to move forward he can't do it; and his urine is retained and his walking is prevented, and your should have him walk on his toe.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign for that which experiences dislocation towards the back is that he doesn't extend his knee, nor can he bend forward as when he bends over; and his leg is shorter than the other one, and his walking becomes smoother, and the tip of his foot should be in that spot.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	The proper reduction of these types of dislocation is that you consider them. If the dislocation is old and has been there for a long time, then when it is already adjusted by your own means in terms of its position, then it should not be reduced completely; thus, do not assume anything from this particular treatment.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	For the case where dislocation is recent and belongs to one of the four types of dislocation, then you have to do what reverses the joint, extends it towards inside parts and outside parts, and moves it to the right and left sides; this force returns it without needing any other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	If it doesn't return in this manner, then prepare for strength and extend the leg of the patient from that direction, or on their knees, or under any muscle that's attached above the knee; and another attendant extends his hand upwards to place their fingers over their knees. And reinforce with a ligament over the tendon of the foot, and have another attendant hold onto the end of the ligament.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And if it's extension of the leg or towards inside parts up to the elbow joint, or from behind to the joint of the buttocks, or from back to the joint of the thigh.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And if all these extensions happen at once while lifting their foot from the ground, and it hangs down.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of extension is common to all four types.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And if the dislocation returns as we've said, it is good; and otherwise, then each type requires its own treatment according to its specific procedure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the self-reduction process of your own dislocated thigh, if the dislocation is towards inside parts, you should make it bend back on its lateral side; and place ligaments over the tendon of the foot in that area which is between the knee cap and the spot where there's inflammation due to heat from a cautery; and extend the ligament upwards from the part near the elbow joint up to the next joint.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another strong minister takes hold of the patient's arms, softens the fatty area of the bad thigh, and extends all parts outward through vigorous extension, so that it returns to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this method is for a slighter treatment of the limb which is reduced like other methods, but to a lesser extent.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	May it be excused if you do not comply with this method of treatment for the whole body, then apply that both feet of the patient are heated at the same time, gently and slightly, on both ankles and both calves.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each one be according to the quantity of four fingers, and let the bad leg be extended more than the other by a quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And place the bad leg hanging from the head of the staff, and have it in your right hand; let the length of this ground be the quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And command a strong young man to hold down the head of the thigh, and have it hanging with the bad leg another young man, and the other young man holds up the thigh with great strength, so that the joint returns to its place at speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	And for the proper reduction, when there is a dislocation outward, apply that the bad leg pushes against the ground as we have prescribed in the warm bath; and strengthen the ligaments over the bad thigh and on its feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And place two staffs, one on the foot of the patient and the other on the head; and place adjusted staffs on each side of the buttock with wet cloths wrapped around them, so that the bad leg does not get damp as the staff is between the thighs, because you must extend the parts left outwards without being pulled back.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And for each minister, extend according to their part, and the doctor with his hand encircles the reduction according to art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	So, if you comply with the reversal, it will go very well; and otherwise, hold onto that carefully and thus as we have said in warm bath for that equality.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	And let the bad leg push against its knees quite gently.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in the front parts, then let the leg be slightly extended, and as per this half of the narrative on the buttock; and the doctor places the palm of his right hand on the bad thigh, and roughly forces that with the other hand, and through that pressure he keeps that extension to the rear parts at the calf.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is in the rear parts, then do not let the bad leg be extended to the rear parts, and it's lifted on the ground; having thus place it under a hard cause, as you would for laying when the width of this is dislocated in the front parts, according to how we said about placing him between two widths; and it's over his face and its ligaments are stretched, as we said almost exactly.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And let compression be administered on the table at the place where it lifts the joint.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	So when the reduction is completed as described - and the sign of the reduction being not hidden from you, that you extend both thighs of it, and when you equalize those in size and the bad leg extends its thigh and expands that sesamoid, then you know that this part has returned according to what's been done; and then you adjust the two limbs and apply plaster and stretch as much as needed so that no swelling occurs in any parts; and hold back the bad leg for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then untie the plaster, examine it, and compare one thigh to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	And when you see those equalities in appearance, then you know that the dislocation has been corrected, and thus allow the bad leg to go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any sign of softening, then you return and plaster that again, stretch it according to your first correction, and let it rest for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then remove that, and have him walk about in both places for some days until he is comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter xxxii.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the treatment of dislocation of the buttock.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The buttock is dislocated in three ways: it is dislocated outwardly at the parts, inwardly at the parts, and more outwardly at the parts than inwardly; it is not dislocated at the front parts.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation in this is that you command the bad leg to apply its thigh to the buttock; then you know that the buttock is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all its ways is that you make the bad leg straight, so that it already extends its thigh, if possible; stick your two hands to his face and pause his foot between your feet; then have another minister apply his buttock against your palms, pull those together with strength between your fingers over his buttock, and have him extend his leg when the buttock returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of restoration is that his thigh sticks to the buttock at rest without effort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then plaster that, have the thigh stick to the buttock, and let those rest for one bend for three or four days, and then remove those.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not use the patient for walking for a few days, until they are healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	If the reduction of you is justified for me, then administer strength extension from those who in the treatment of the hip have been preceded by narrative.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the treatment of the dislocation of the femur.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The femur is sometimes displaced due to slight force, and in other cases it is displaced according to position, and the displacement of you occurs either internally or externally.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of the displacement of you is that when you press the femur towards the part where it is displaced.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The treatment of the displacement of you is a minor readjustment; it must be extended with support for your hands and maintained until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	When in the treatment of you when it is displaced according to position, you should make the patient lie straight, have one of those on your legs strong and brave from that part behind both feet at the middle point of him.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then take your right hand to the top of the patient's foot and your left hand from the lower part of the foot at the place of the cavity.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then pull the foot towards you with your right hand, and from left twice, and extend your left hand; and push the feet of the foot to the right side according to the cavity these work.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do those two movements as we have discussed.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then push the feet towards the cavity at the third movement, and you are at the cavity.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns in one or two movements according to this manner, and if you make the patient lie straight, it's good; and otherwise, then on you perform the operation again, when that has returned.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	If for you the reduction of you is prohibited in this manner that we have recommended, then make the patient lie on their back on the ground, and place a piece of wood under them on solid ground, and place it between your thighs, and you have already enveloped around you sheet so as not to move the patient.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And the attendant of you has their thighs ready, and another servant extends their feet with their hands or on a mat that lies over the back of the foot; and extend each attendant against the extension of his pair, and the blanket is lying between the patient's thighs, so that the body of you does not be pulled towards the lower parts opposite to its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And the doctor equalizes the displacement with his hands, and another attendant holds the healthy thigh in the lower parts, where the displacement returns by ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And when the displacement returns and its declaration of your health is confirmed with the reduction of you, then pause the plastering and strengthen that by vigorously placing it on wood, and place the foot onto the cavity.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And when you fear or protect from the nerves that are behind on top of the femur, for the muscle over there not to be vigorous and harm that strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then let him rest for two or three days; and if the muscle is softened, strengthen that.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And then on the third day or the fourth, untie him and prohibit the patient from walking for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	If it is forced to go before that space, then there must not be doubt that the displacement will not dissolve and corrupt in him, and anything that does not receive treatment should be avoided.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if it happens that you get an abscess in the femur, then you should administer according to what preceded our narrative, in another place of treatment and application, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter XXXIV.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of dislocation of the fingers of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Make sure that which is displaced is equal to a little extension of your hands; and what is not difficult, before it is minor.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	If the displacement is in some joints of both feet, then you should make the patient lie on their back over a location equal to half of the ground or on a table, and be standing as if they were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then stand on your feet, place your hand over what you are pressing from the joints, and apply pressure with your foot while bending it within so that it returns; and see that he is already equalized and does not appear in the pressing location.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then place the abdomen of you with a table that takes all the foot, on which there are two ends, and strengthen it with good structure and firmness for three days; and then untie him and make rest from walking for several days, until he is strengthened and his recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	On the types of displacement that occur from inflammation or from fracture, or at any time.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any cause of those occurs, and you apply yourself to the treatment of that and in restoring him, several movements follow death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And do not presume on the treatment of you, but that which is wise in the art, long used, merciful and compassionate; slow, not impulsive or presumptuous; who uses medicines that apply to abscesses alone, leaves the patient to divine judgment, rather than to any other for whom you hope recovery from illness, with alleviation of malaise, and in which you have some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then strive to make such an effort that you reduce him during the beginning of the cause, before it becomes a boil.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And when the member returns according to our wish, then administer treatment which allows for the use of a pointed cautery and care for the wound in such a way that it suits your needs using dry ointments.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if dislocation is like a fracture and happens in the separated bones, then you perform their surgery, and do it as we have said in the simple diseases of this that were described in those places.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And according to your skill, avoid or guard as you see fit in the midst of fear along the paths that were guided by my teaching; for what is better for you, you should do with your Creator, and more lasting for your glory, and more healthful for your true self, which you will see in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the words of Al-Bucajim, may God bless them.
Amen.	Amen.
